title: The Walrus Operator (:=)
shortDescription: Python 3.8 introduced the walrus operator (:=) for assignment expressions!
detailedDescription: The walrus operator (:=) allows assignment within expressions, making code more concise in certain situations. Named for its resemblance to a walrus's eyes and tusks, this operator assigns a value to a variable and returns that value in a single expression.
examples: results = [squared for x in range(10) if (squared := x ** 2) > 10]
